name: Leptandra
Relationship: Compare: PODO.; IRIS; BRY.; MERC.; PTEL.; MYRICA.

Head: Smarting and aching in eyes
Dull frontal pain; vertigo, drowsiness, and depression
Stomach: Aching in region of liver extending to spine, which feels chilly
Great distress in stomach and intestines, with desire for stool
Stool: Typhoid stools turn black and look like tar
Profuse, BLACK, FETID STOOLS, with pain at umbilicus

details: A liver remedy, with jaundice and BLACK, TARRY STOOLS. Bilious states. Enfeebled portal circulation. Malarial conditions.
